title.narrative: Rural Development: Rural Development and Modernization Project for the Central and Paracentral Regions

description.narrative: The project includes three major thrusts: (i) development of the human and social capital resource base by strengthening the effective organizational, managerial and decision-making capacities of rural communities, producer associations, associations for community development (ADESCOS), cooperatives and sectoral service providers; (ii) transformation of the currently subsistence agricultural and non-agricultural activities into profitable, market-oriented rural businesses and microenterprises, for local and external markets, with the support of specialised technical and business-related assistance, the resources of key competitive coinvestment funds, and access to financial services; and (iii) rehabilitation of the environmentally deteriorated areas, by rationally managing the country''s natural resources and institutionalising territorial planning in selected micro watersheds.From a country programme perspective, the project seeks to facilitate coordination of rural development projects and programmes and the harmonization of poverty intervention strategies, and thus: (i) the consolidation of the national structures for rural development, starting with the Project Coordination Office (PCO), Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock (MAG); and (ii) the formulation of a national rural development programme in which IFAD is expected to play a role. Central to this strategy is also the reactivation of the National Rural Development Forum (RDF) (Mesa Ampliada de Desarrollo Rural), with the involvement of GOES, civil society and international cooperation agencies.

job-title.narrative: MesoAmerica and the Caribbean Hub Head

description.narrative: This point represents the centroid of the project area. For more detailed geographic information, please refer to the project page on the IFAD website.
